subject: JUnit 4.0 release candidate 2 internal packages
msgSnippet: I see in the release notes: * runner -- published classes related to running tests * runner.extensions -- examples of new Runners * runner.internal --
messageBody:
I see in the release notes:

* runner -- published classes related to running tests
* runner.extensions -- examples of new Runners
* runner.internal -- implementation details of running tests
* runner.internal.request -- implementation details of Requests

Internal packages always smell pretty bad to me. You can rest assured
that given a framework as widely used as JUnit, someone, somewhere
(probably several someones) will start depending on these.

I recommend moving all these classes into the runner package and making
them non-public. If for some reason that's impossible, then move as much
as possible into non-public classes and make sure that these packages
are excluded in toto from the JavaDoc. (The latter seems to be done
already.)
